title: Design Methods
cover: A photograph of user interface wireframes.
What design is and how to do it.
unknown: A photograph of user interface wireframes.
description: After teaching design for many years, I longed for a simple, concise, and practical introduction to design for technically-minded people. In response, I've distilled my lectures from the past decade into these brief chapters. They don't represent _everything_ we know about design, and they certainly only represent my own  stance on design, but my students have found them be accessible introduction to big ideas in design. I hope you enjoy! If you see something missing or wrong, [submit an issue|https://github.com/amyjko/design-methods].
chapters: A photograph of a design studio
Despite what this image shows, they do more than sit at computers.
A squiggle line converting toward a straight line
A complex tangled rope with people trying to disentangle it.
Most problems are wicked entanglements that require careful study.
A screen capture of a pronunciation of the the word 'problem', from the Oxford English Dictionary
We can't define them fully, but we can try.
A vector graphic of a lightbulb
A photograph of a sketch of a mobile application.
A screenshot of the iOS and Android home screens.
Interfaces are not natural; they're carefully envisioned and evolved.
A photograph of a design critique, with designs on a wall and two peopel looking at them.
One source of evaluation is other designers.
A photograph of one person observing another person use a software application
Empiricism involves observing use to evaluate designs.
Clip art of a clipboard with a check list.
Analysis involves using principles to evaluate designs.
revisions: Revised the book to incorporate concepts of design justice, to center anti-racist, anti-sexist, anti-ableist notions of oppressions in design.
First draft of the book release.
